      • init

        protected InitDataObject init(java.lang.String params,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

        1) Checks if SSL is required. If it is required and no secure request is provided, throws a ForbiddenException.

        2) If 1) does not throw an exception, returns an InitDataObject with a Map containing the keys and values extracted from params

        Parameters:
        params - a string containing parameters in the /key/value form
        request -
        Returns:
        an initDataObject with the resulting Map

      • init

        protected InitDataObject init(java.lang.String params,
                  boolean authenticate,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  boolean rejectWhenNoUser)
                       throws SecurityException

        1) Checks if SSL is required. If it is required and no secure request is provided, throws a ForbiddenException.

        2) If 1) does not throw an exception, returns an InitDataObject with:
        a) a Map with the keys and values extracted from params.

        if authenticate is set to true:
        b) , an authenticated User, if found. If no User can be retrieved, and rejectWhenNoUser is true, it will throw an exception, otherwise returns null.

        There are five ways to get the User. They are executed in the specified order. When found, the remaining ways won't be executed.
        1) Using username and password contained in params.
        2) Using username and password in Base64 contained in the request HEADER parameter DOTAUTH.
        3) Using username and password in Base64 contained in the request HEADER parameter AUTHORIZATION (BASIC Auth).
        4) From the session. It first tries to get the Backend logged in user. If no user found, tries to get the Frontend logged in user.

        Parameters:
        params - a string containing the URL parameters in the /key/value form
        authenticate -
        request -
        rejectWhenNoUser - determines whether a SecurityException is thrown or not when authentication fails.
        Returns:
        an initDataObject with the resulting Map
        Throws:
        SecurityException
